subtasks: Examine plant for dead or diseased foliage and remove.
Severely prune hibiscus to reduce water and nutrition needs.
Rinse plant thoroughly with high-pressure water to remove pests and dust.
Apply neem oil or soap solution to plants before moving indoors.
Store hibiscus in a cool area (55-65°F) if possible for optimal pest management.
Alternatively, provide bright light and maintain temperatures above 70°F for growth and flowering.
Water sparingly and do not fertilize during overwintering.
Rotate plants periodically to promote even growth.
Implement regular pest management practices, including monthly foliar washes.
Ensure proper drainage in pots and avoid waterlogged trays.
